meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tyrannical.
meanings.sent1: Her tyrannicalness was evident in the way she controlled every aspect of the company.
meanings.sent2: The king's tyrannicalness caused fear among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small stature, his tyrannicalness in the kitchen made everyone follow his orders.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds symbolized the tyrannicalness of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's tyrannicalness in grading made the students anxious about their exams.

meanings.definition: The behavior or actions of a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The tyrannicalness of the dictator led to protests in the streets.
meanings.sent2: History is filled with examples of the tyrannicalness of rulers throughout the ages.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tyrannicalness over the household was evident when it demanded to be fed at 5 am.
meanings.sent4: The tyrannicalness of the traffic jam made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannicalness of the bully made the other kids afraid to speak up.
